intro: Arnebia echioides, commonly known as the Indian madder, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including India and China. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, pinkish-red flowers. The plant produces bright red roots that have been historically used as a natural dye. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Arnebia echioides is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
